author: Suresh Kumar
text:
Land sharks misusing the judicial system to obtain death certificates of living persons to effect fraudulent transfers of lands have come under scrutiny.

'Time to crack the whip'

“We smell a rat and it is time for us to crack the whip and set our house in order,” the judges added.

The Bench then appointed R. Mohandoss, a retired District Judge, as Commissioner, to study the procedure adopted by magistrates in conducting inquiry under the Act and to file a report about the possibilities and nature of misuse of the procedure. Through a further direction, the Bench instructed all Judicial Officers to provide necessary information sought for by the Commissioner and render assistance.

The Commissioners of Corporations and Municipalities, Tahsildars, Revenue Officials, Registration Officials, and Panchayat Officials were also directed to furnish the required information sought for by the Commissioner.

Posted to March 24

The Bench then posted the matter to March 24 for filing the report.
title: Judicial Officers told to provide info
